attributes.action: Formally recognise the excellent work of the Alternative Curriculum in positively influencing the lives of disaffected young people
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Alternative Curriculum engage disadvantaged and at risk young people, to enhance lifelong personal and social development skills away from the constraints of the formal classroom and traditional teaching methods, assisting young people to make the transition from youth to adulthood. The Alternative Curriculum delivers in working military barracks and offers a unique range of military themed activities to stimulate minds and develop previously untapped strengths and skills as a method of enabling the young person to develop and reach their full potential.

The organisation has engaged over 2000 of the hardest to reach young people in the last 12 months alone and is commissioned through the public sector bodies including Connexions, Children’s and Young Peoples Services, New Deal for Communities and Local Authorities. 93% participants complete the course and a high proportion have gone on to start careers in the armed services or other related employment opportunities.
